original_solution_mapping.L1: So Lidia will spend 4 * 15 = $<<4*15=60>>60 on apps.
original_solution_mapping.L2: She already has $66, so she will be left with 66 - 60 = $<<66-60=6>>6.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5852.
    Returns: the amount of money Lidia will be left with after buying all apps.
    """
    # L1
    app_cost = 4 # One app costs $4
    num_apps = 15 # needs 15 of them
    total_app_cost = app_cost * num_apps

    # L2
    initial_money = 66 # She has $66 for this purpose
    money_left = initial_money - total_app_cost

    # FA
    answer = money_left
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: So Lidia will spend {app_cost} * {num_apps} = $<<{app_cost}*{num_apps}={total_app_cost}>>{total_app_cost} on apps.
She already has ${initial_money}, so she will be left with {initial_money} - {total_app_cost} = $<<{initial_money}-{total_app_cost}={money_left}>>{money_left}.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: So Lidia will spend 4 * 15 = $<<4*15=60>>60 on apps.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: She already has $66, so she will be left with 66 - 4 = $<<66-4=62>>62.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'app_cost' (value: 4) was used instead of 'total_app_cost' (value: 60).
